pr_title: [BEAM-9712] Refactor ZetaSQL planner code and support setting default timezone

timeline.message: Refactor ZetaSQL planner code and support setting default timezone
Refactor ZetaSQL planner code and support setting default timezone

timeline.bodyText: Can you add a note about which values are allowed here?
timeline.author: ibzib

timeline.bodyText: If defaultTimezone is set here, we should warn the user it will have no effect.
timeline.author: ibzib

timeline.bodyText: Can you create and link a JIRA?
timeline.author: ibzib

replies.bodyText: Actually this config does not seem to apply to CalciteSQL, so I have reverted this change.
replies.author: robinyqiu

replies.bodyText:
Actually this config does not seem to apply to CalciteSQL

Why not?
replies.author: ibzib

replies.bodyText: Default timezone affects the result of many time-related functions in ZetaSQL. In CalciteSQL language spec, I did not find any mention of default timezone. I guess this concept may not apply to CalciteSQL, or it does not affect CalciteSQL in the same way. So I am leaving the CalciteSQL part unchanged and make it clear the new option only applies to ZetaSQL dialect.
replies.author: robinyqiu

timeline.bodyText: While we're at it, maybe we should rename this getAnalyzerOptions. To me, init implies a one-time setup operation, which this is not.
timeline.author: ibzib

timeline.bodyText: Consider making this a javadoc comment so we can add a link.
timeline.author: ibzib

timeline.bodyText: nit: I'd prefer if you didn't rename this method, there are a bunch of references to it inside google. (Alternatively please rename the method of the same name in the C++ validator to match.)
timeline.author: apilloud

replies.bodyText:
Thanks for the reminder! I will remember to rename them.
Reminder to @ibzib as well. I found you are also changing this file frequently these days. Any change made here should also be made to the internal validator code written in C++. I will sync the validator code later today to include the changes so far. In the future if you make changes again, please make sure you do that as well.
replies.author: robinyqiu

replies.bodyText:
Any change made here should also be made to the internal validator code written in C++.

Acknowledged.

I will sync the validator code later today to include the changes so far.

Sounds good, please cc me on those changes.
replies.author: ibzib
